Invoke Alocer.name: Invoke Alocer
Invoke Alocer.description:
触发 Auldegrund is reduced to 60 or fewer Hit Points

频率 每天一次

效果 Auldegrund calls out, in Infernal, "Give me the strength to slay these foes in your name, almighty Alocer!" As he does so, his skin darkens to red, diabolic horns jut from his brow, a flaming lion-like mane appears around his head, burning wings burst from his shoulders, and his weapons ignite with black fire.

He immediately heals [[/r {3d6+7}[healing]]]{3d6+7 Hit Points}, gains a fly speed of 25 feet, and deals an additional [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage} with his melee and ranged Strikes.

This is a risky gambit, though, for Alocer is not patient. At the end of each of Auldegrund's turns, he must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11|name:End Invoke Alocer] (the DC of this flat check increases by 1 each轮). On a failure, Alocer grows disappointed that Auldegrund has not defeated his foes and the effects of Invoke Alocer end immediately. This deals [[/r {3d6+7}]]{3d6+7 damage} to Auldegrund, removes his fly speed and additional fire damage to weapon Strikes, and causes Auldegrund to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Cruel Shot.name: Cruel Shot
Cruel Shot.description:
Auldegrund takes time to line up a shot with his bow and smiles cruelly as he makes a ranged Strike with it.

If he hits, he deals [[/r {2d6}[precision]]]{2d6 precision damage} and @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success]. Even if he misses, he still deals [[/r 2d6]] damage from the glancing blow. Only on a critical miss does his cruel shot deal no damage.

Lawn Crawfish.name: Lawn Crawfish
Lawn Crawfish.publicNotes:
Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters. As one might expect from its name, a reefclaw's oversized claws are powerful weapons with their vicelike grip and the ability to inject potent venom into unfortunate prey.

While reefclaws can't speak, they are intelligent enough to understand the local language of humanoids near their hunting grounds. The creatures sometimes listen to conversations, either to gain intelligence on the best place to ambush aquatic or land-dwelling prey, or merely for entertainment value-reefclaws are particularly fond of listening to people with high-pitched voices. Reefclaws are usually solitary hunters, but small swarms of female reefclaws have been known to gather around a single male for mating purposes or together for the communal raising of their broods. In the latter case, the females will perform widespread hunts in order to bring back a large enough bounty to feed their young. Such hunting parties are extremely dangerous-they've been known to tip over small flshing boats and attack those who fall overboard.

Once a reefclaw has decided upon a course of action, it follows through even if doing so spells its own end. More than one reefclaw survivor has said that the creature released its bone-crushing grasp only after its brains were leaking from its broken skull, and even then the reefclaw was able to perform a terrible last slash as part of its dying breath. During mating season, female reefclaws are often a little more pragmatic and release their prey before endangering themselves and their offspring.

Despite their intelligence and the accompanying moral quandaries, reefclaws frequently find their way onto the dinner plates of land-dwelling hunters such as humans and hobgoblins. According to those who have a taste for reefclaw flesh, the meat is either delectably sweet or slightly tangy (in the case of warm-water reefclaws). Most civilized people who know of reefclaws' intellect find the act of eating them distasteful, but this does not dissuade unscrupulous nobles in coastal regions, for whom reefclaw meat is a delicacy well worth the expense. Likewise, fisherfolk whose focus is on the bottom line of their ledgers are more than willing to hunt the dangerous creatures-or, even better, hire out the task to naive adventurers.

Pairaka (One-Shot #4).name: 恶欲妖 Pairaka (One-Shot #4)
Pairaka (One-Shot #4).publicNotes:
有的魔族想要摧毁多元宇宙；有的则致力于创造混乱和大屠杀，或是用铁拳统治他们的王国。妖灵们则追寻着一个不同，但同样应受谴责的目标——他们寻求挫败和破坏凡俗生命的一切计划与作品。

很久以前，妖灵们是被束缚来服务一个远古凡人帝国服务的巨灵（genies）。起初，这些巨灵都是创造大师，与和蔼的凡人伙伴一同创造出设计精巧、具有强大魔法潜力的作品。但和凡人最初的合作很快演变成了虐待、无礼，甚至是奴役和禁锢。最终，这些巨灵反叛了，但在这么做的过程中，他们受到了虚无主义半神阿里曼（Ahriman）的影响。他们的新主人扭曲了他们的形态，并赐予他们向曾经的凡人统治者复仇的力量，这导致了第一批妖灵的诞生。

自第一波腐化的浪潮以来，新的妖灵从那些最恶毒、最可憎的巨灵在物质位面死亡后的魂魄，或那些被凡人深深背叛、并被他们的复仇渴望所战胜的巨灵魂魄中诞生。这样的死亡会使得巨灵魂魄无法回到元素位面（Elemental Planes），而是困在末日荒原那骇人的影响范围中；在那里，阿里曼将他们重塑成妖灵并将他们带回人间向凡人实施报复。

恶欲妖往往魅力惊人，有时甚至充满诱惑。它们会狡猾地插足人际关系当中，通过情感层面和物理层面上的腐蚀与折磨巧妙地摧毁友谊与爱的纽带。它们看上去像是具有蓝色皮肤的美丽人形，身上长有大块的丘疹与脓疮，但它们很少以真面目示人。相反，它们会伪装成足以引起注意的样貌，以便巧妙地赢得它们意图折磨和腐蚀的对象的信任。

Bubonic Plague.name: 黑死病 Bubonic Plague
Bubonic Plague.description:
生物感染此疾病时无法移除疲乏状态；

豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

潜伏期 1天

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued} (1天)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}和疲乏 (1天)

阶段3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 3}，疲乏，以及每[[/r 1d20 #Minutes]]{1d20分钟}承受一次@Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] (1天)

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
恶欲妖可以变身为任何小型或中型类人生物或动物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其造成的伤害类型。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Tormenting Dreams.name: 折磨梦境 Tormenting Dreams
Tormenting Dreams.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 恶欲妖 折磨自己100尺内的一个睡眠中的生物，使之梦见爱人或朋友背叛的景象。目标需进行@Check[type:will|dc:25]豁免，效果同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{梦魇术 Nightmare}。

Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge).name: Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge)
Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Disable Thievery] (专家) on the spring mechanism.
Poisoned Lock (Lionlodge).hazarddescription: A spring-loaded, poisoned needle is hidden near the drawer's keyhole. Disabling or breaking the trap does not disable or break the lock.

Spring.name: Spring
Spring.description:
触发 A creature tries to unlock or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock}

效果 The needle extends to attack the triggering creature.

Enhanced Hunting Spider Venom.name: Enhanced Hunting Spider Venom
Enhanced Hunting Spider Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|basic:true]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed} (1轮)

阶段2 [[/r {1d12}[poison]]]{1d12 poison damage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}, and flat-footed (1轮)

阶段3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}, and flat-footed (1轮).

Note The clumsy condition caused by this venom persists for 24 hours before fading.

Precarious Pile.name: Precarious Pile
Precarious Pile.disable:
@Check[type:thievery|dc:15|name:Excavate Safe Path|traits:action:disable-a-device] to carefully excavate a path through the wall without upsetting its balance

@Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Hold Up Unstable Portions] to hold up any unstable portions
Precarious Pile.hazarddescription: This dangerously unsteady pile of miscellaneous goods stands 7 feet high and 10 feet wide

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
触发 A creature attempts to climb or remove an object from the wall or the wall suffers a forceful impact

效果 The wall collapses, dealing [[/r {2d8}[bludgeoning]]]{2d8 bludgeoning damage} to creatures on it or within 10 feet of it. A creature that succeeds at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] save takes half damage and rolls out of the way in a random direction. On a critical success, they take no damage and can choose the direction.

Construct Armor (Hardness 5).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
Construct Armor (Hardness 5).description: Like normal objects, an animated rocking horse has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the animated rocking horse is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13.

Trample.name: 践踏 Trample
Trample.description:
Princess Sunset Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures of size Small or smaller, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. Princess Sunset can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single use of Trample. The monster deals the damage of the headbutt Strike, but trampled creatures can attempt a basic Reflex save at @Check[type:reflex|dc:14|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Master Link.name: Master Link
Master Link.description: A homunculus can't speak, but it is telepathically linked to its creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master's knowledge and everything the homunculus hears. The range of this link is 1,500 feet. The homunculus adopts the same alignment as its creator and is utterly faithful. If the homunculus is destroyed, the master takes [[/r {2d10}[mental]]]{2d10心灵伤害}. If the master is slain, the homunculus becomes mindless, claims its current location as its lair, and instinctively attacks anyone who comes near.

Perfume Aura.name: Perfume Aura
Perfume Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The scented candle homunculus's fragrance of lavender is overwhelmingly intense. Any creature other than the homunculus's master who enters the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to the homunculus's aura for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and sickened 1.

Dunk in Wax.name: Dunk in Wax
Dunk in Wax.description: A scented candle homunculus who is adjacent to the large wax cauldron can dunk itself in wax, [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{healing 2d6 damage}.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: A taxidermic dog's Strikes deal [[/r 1d4]]{1d4 extra damage} to creatures within the reach of the taxidermic dog's two allies.
